description: The sequence a of 1's and 2's starting with (1,1,2,1) such that a(n) is the length of the (n+2)nd run of a.
comments: It appears that various properties and unsolved problems associated with the Oldenburger-Kolakoski sequence, A000002, apply also to A022300.
links: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
example: a(1) =1, so the 3rd run has length 1, so a(5) must be 2.a(2) = 1, so the 4th run has length 1, so a(6) = 1.a(3) = 2, so the 5th run has length 2, so a(7) = 1 and a(8) = 2.a(4) = 1, so the 6th run has length 1, so a(9) = 1.Globally, the runlength sequence of a is 2,1,1,1,2,1,2,1,1,2,1,1,2,...., and deleting the first two terms leaves a = A022300.
mathematica: a = {1, 1, 2}; Do[a = Join[a, ConstantArray[If[Last[a] == 1, 2, 1], {a[[n]]}]], {n, 200}]; a(* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Apr 01 2016 *)
